Keywords: Agents of Atlas , Fantastic Four , Reporter , S.H.I.E.L.D. , Spider-Man Family
Real Name: Cindy Moon
Special Powers
MOVEMENT: Elevated, Hindering
FOUR S.H.I.E.L.D. BEAST HUNTERS: When Silk is given a MOVE action, after resolutions remove an action token from her and she can use Stealth until your next turn.
SILK SENSE: Super Senses, but succeeds on a 4-6. Protected: Outwit.

February 24, 2021
Goop
I'm not convinced this piece is that great. No damage powers at all and her stats are all average. With the willpower change she does become better and 50/50 SS is always good. Still i'm not that impressed for 75pts. For 30pts though, her second line is better.
January 28, 2021
DatHomieSilverSurfer
so between her trait and the changes to willpower, I guess this chick is never going to end a turn with an action token on her
August 3, 2020
mc268
Silk is great at either point value, either as a full fledged character with a surprisingly deep dial (compared to most of her spider family), or as a low point version. The lower point cost will be used a fair bit to fill point costs and share a useful team ability, but due to the traits, she has decent survival chances. The full dial is pretty solid though and good for the character. I’m glad they’ve found a way, based on this, the Earth X Ben LE, and the Miles and Gwen from the Carnage set to keep spider people feeling similar, yet distinct, showcasing their differences. The sculpt is also rather cool looking too, definitely glad this ended up being one of the least expensive SRs of the set.
July 14, 2020
DatHomieSilverSurfer
While it's definitely nice to see a spider-character get 7 clicks of life again (which used to be the lower end of the spectrum for spider-powered characters back in the day) for a few more points, she vastly improves on the lame as hell dial her last iteration got, along with a much more dynamic sculpt. even though I'd prefer to see her in the spider-man/venom set, she's now yet another piece from this set that I can't wait to get my hands on
